TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi abstract beforefieldinit OrderablePartitioner`1<TSource> extends System.Collections.Concurrent.Partitioner`1<!TSource>
Public MustInherit Class OrderablePartitioner(Of TSource) Inherits Partitioner(Of TSource)
generic <typename TSource> public ref class OrderablePartitioner abstract : System::Collections::Concurrent::Partitioner<TSource>

Docs.typeparam: Type of the elements in the collection.
Docs.summary: Represents a particular manner of splitting an orderable data source into multiple partitions.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The implementation of the derived class is responsible for ordering the elements into key-value pairs in whatever manner is appropriate. For more information, see [Custom Partitioners for PLINQ and TPL](~/docs/standard/parallel-programming/custom-partitioners-for-plinq-and-tpl.md).
## Examples The following example shows how to implement an orderable partitioner that returns one element at a time:
[!code-csharp[System.Collections.Concurrent.OrderablePartitioner#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.collections.concurrent.orderablepartitioner/cs/orderablepartitioner.cs#1)] [!code-vb[System.Collections.Concurrent.OrderablePartitioner#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.collections.concurrent.orderablepartitioner/vb/orderablepartitioner.vb#1)]

Docs.threadsafe: All public members of are thread-safe and may be called from multiple threads concurrently.
Docs.related: How to: Speed Up Small Loop Bodies
How to: Implement Dynamic Partitions

MemberSignature.Value: protected OrderablePartitioner (bool keysOrderedInEachPartition, bool keysOrderedAcrossPartitions, bool keysNormalized);
.method familyhidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(bool keysOrderedInEachPartition, bool keysOrderedAcrossPartitions, bool keysNormalized) cil managed
Protected Sub New (keysOrderedInEachPartition As Boolean, keysOrderedAcrossPartitions As Boolean, keysNormalized As Boolean)
protected: OrderablePartitioner(bool keysOrderedInEachPartition, bool keysOrderedAcrossPartitions, bool keysNormalized);

Docs.param: Indicates whether the elements in each partition are yielded in the order of increasing keys.

Indicates whether elements in an earlier partition always come before elements in a later partition. If true, each element in partition 0 has a smaller order key than any element in partition 1, each element in partition 1 has a smaller order key than any element in partition 2, and so on.

Indicates whether keys are normalized. If true, all order keys are distinct integers in the range [0 .. numberOfElements-1]. If false, order keys must still be distinct, but only their relative order is considered, not their absolute values.
Docs.summary: Called from constructors in derived classes to initialize the class with the specified constraints on the index keys.

remarks.format: ## Remarks For more information, see [Custom Partitioners for PLINQ and TPL](~/docs/standard/parallel-programming/custom-partitioners-for-plinq-and-tpl.md).

Docs.related: Custom Partitioners for PLINQ and TPL

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig virtual instance class System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable`1<!TSource> GetDynamicPartitions() cil managed
Public Overrides Function GetDynamicPartitions () As IEnumerable(Of TSource)

Docs.summary: Creates an object that can partition the underlying collection into a variable number of partitions.
Docs.returns: An object that can create partitions over the underlying data source.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The returned object implements the <xref:System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable%601?displayProperty=nameWithType> interface. Calling <xref:System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable%601.GetEnumerator%2A> on the object creates another partition over the sequence.
The default implementation provides the same behavior as <xref:System.Collections.Concurrent.OrderablePartitioner%601.GetOrderableDynamicPartitions%2A> except that the returned set of partitions does not provide the keys for the elements.
The <xref:System.Collections.Concurrent.OrderablePartitioner%601.GetDynamicPartitions%2A> method is only supported if the <xref:System.Collections.Concurrent.Partitioner%601.SupportsDynamicPartitions%2A> property returns true.
For more information, see [Custom Partitioners for PLINQ and TPL](~/docs/standard/parallel-programming/custom-partitioners-for-plinq-and-tpl.md).

Docs.exception: Dynamic partitioning is not supported by the base class. It must be implemented in derived classes.
Docs.related: Custom Partitioners for PLINQ and TPL
How to: Speed Up Small Loop Bodies
How to: Implement a Partitioner With a Static Number of Partitions
How to: Implement Dynamic Partitions

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance class System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable`1<valuetype System.Collections.Generic.KeyValuePair`2<int64, !TSource>> GetOrderableDynamicPartitions() cil managed
Public Overridable Function GetOrderableDynamicPartitions () As IEnumerable(Of KeyValuePair(Of Long, TSource))

abstract member GetOrderableDynamicPartitions : unit -> seq<System.Collections.Generic.KeyValuePair<int64, 'Source>> override this.GetOrderableDynamicPartitions : unit -> seq<System.Collections.Generic.KeyValuePair<int64, 'Source>>

Docs.summary: Creates an object that can partition the underlying collection into a variable number of partitions.
Docs.returns: An object that can create partitions over the underlying data source.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The returned object implements the <xref:System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable%601?displayProperty=nameWithType> interface. Calling <xref:System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable%601.GetEnumerator%2A> on the object creates another partition over the sequence.
Each partition is represented as an enumerator over key-value pairs. The value in the pair is the element itself, and the key is an integer which determines the relative ordering of this element against other elements.
The <xref:System.Collections.Concurrent.OrderablePartitioner%601.GetOrderableDynamicPartitions%2A> method is only supported if the <xref:System.Collections.Concurrent.Partitioner%601.SupportsDynamicPartitions%2A> property returns true.
For more information, see [Custom Partitioners for PLINQ and TPL](~/docs/standard/parallel-programming/custom-partitioners-for-plinq-and-tpl.md).

Docs.exception: Dynamic partitioning is not supported by this partitioner.
Docs.related: Custom Partitioners for PLINQ and TPL
How to: Speed Up Small Loop Bodies
How to: Implement a Partitioner With a Static Number of Partitions
How to: Implement Dynamic Partitions

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance class System.Collections.Generic.IList`1<class System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerator`1<valuetype System.Collections.Generic.KeyValuePair`2<int64, !TSource>>> GetOrderablePartitions(int32 partitionCount) cil managed
Public MustOverride Function GetOrderablePartitions (partitionCount As Integer) As IList(Of IEnumerator(Of KeyValuePair(Of Long, TSource)))

Docs.param: The number of partitions to create.
Docs.summary: Partitions the underlying collection into the specified number of orderable partitions.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Each partition is represented as an enumerator over key-value pairs.
The value of the pair is the element itself, and the key is an integer which determines the relative ordering of this element against other elements in the data source.
For more information, see [Custom Partitioners for PLINQ and TPL](~/docs/standard/parallel-programming/custom-partitioners-for-plinq-and-tpl.md).

Docs.related: Custom Partitioners for PLINQ and TPL

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig virtual instance class System.Collections.Generic.IList`1<class System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerator`1<!TSource>> GetPartitions(int32 partitionCount) cil managed
Public Overrides Function GetPartitions (partitionCount As Integer) As IList(Of IEnumerator(Of TSource))

Docs.param: The number of partitions to create.
Docs.summary: Partitions the underlying collection into the given number of ordered partitions.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The default implementation provides the same behavior as <xref:System.Collections.Concurrent.OrderablePartitioner%601.GetOrderablePartitions%2A> except that the returned set of partitions does not provide the keys for the elements.
For more information, see [Custom Partitioners for PLINQ and TPL](~/docs/standard/parallel-programming/custom-partitioners-for-plinq-and-tpl.md).

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property KeysNormalized As Boolean
public: property bool KeysNormalized { bool get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets whether order keys are normalized.
Docs.value: if the keys are normalized; otherwise, .

remarks.format:
## Remarks If <xref:System.Collections.Concurrent.OrderablePartitioner%601.KeysNormalized%2A> returns true, all order keys are distinct integers in the range [0 .. numberOfElements-1]. If the property returns false, order keys must still be distinct, but only their relative order is considered, not their absolute values.
For more information, see [Custom Partitioners for PLINQ and TPL](~/docs/standard/parallel-programming/custom-partitioners-for-plinq-and-tpl.md).

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property KeysOrderedAcrossPartitions As Boolean
public: property bool KeysOrderedAcrossPartitions { bool get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets whether elements in an earlier partition always come before elements in a later partition.
Docs.value: if the elements in an earlier partition always come before elements in a later partition; otherwise, .

remarks.format:
## Remarks If <xref:System.Collections.Concurrent.OrderablePartitioner%601.KeysOrderedAcrossPartitions%2A> returns true, each element in partition 0 has a smaller order key than any element in partition 1, each element in partition 1 has a smaller order key than any element in partition 2, and so on.
For more information, see [Custom Partitioners for PLINQ and TPL](~/docs/standard/parallel-programming/custom-partitioners-for-plinq-and-tpl.md).
